intro: Zehneria martinez-crovettoi, commonly known as the Mexican zehneria, is a flowering plant species native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
